meanings.sent1: The primero step in baking a cake is to preheat the oven.
meanings.sent2: She always finishes her homework primero before playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The race was so close that the primero runner crossed the finish line by a hair.
meanings.sent4: The primero rays of sunlight peeked through the clouds, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The primero snowflake of winter gently fell from the sky, landing on her nose.

meanings.definition: A card game similar to poker.
meanings.sent1: During the family gathering, they played a friendly game of primero.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys spending his evenings playing primero with his friends.
meanings.sent3: In the old western movies, the cowboys often played primero to pass the time.
meanings.sent4: The high-stakes primero game in the saloon attracted gamblers from all around.
meanings.sent5: She learned how to play primero from her grandfather, who was a skilled card player.

meanings.sent1: The traditional festival featured a lively performance of the primero.
meanings.sent2: She practiced the steps of the primero dance for weeks before the recital.
meanings.sent3: During the fiesta, everyone joined in the fun of dancing the primero.
meanings.sent4: The graceful movements of the primero captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: Her favorite part of the Spanish culture class was learning the primero dance.
